moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. e5 c5: I like playing the advanced french though this is the first time I have played this line where I advance my c5 pawn.
moves.6. a3 f6: This is a new idea I started trying out.  I like it.
moves.9. Bc2 Nh6: In order to bring my knight to f7.  My thinking is that if it is taken then I get the g and f files for my rooks.  I will also get some queenside pawns with my Qb6.
moves.10. O-O Nf7 11. Qe2 g6: In order to add pressure on e5.
moves.14. Bd4 O-O 15. Re1 Bd7: I now feel pretty safe.  I have a good position but am unsure of where to go!
moves.16. Bc2: So I set about creating a passed pawn.
moves.16... a5 17. Nbd2 b5: My opponent is unsure of what to do I think.
moves.18. Nf1 Nxd4: Nxd4.  I consider this move to be good because I am taking away a pawn from guarding b4.  If white recaptures with the knight then I get the e5 pawn.
moves.23. Bb1 c3 24. bxc3 Qxc3 25. Ne3 Ra1: At this point my opponent was running out of time (under 1 minute left).
moves.26. Qd2: I didn't see a way to avoid the queen exchange.
moves.26... Qxd2 27. Nxd2 Ba4: Rushing my pieces over to the passed pawn.
moves.31. Nxb3: The knight sacrifices himself for the pawn.
moves.31... Rxb1: I took the bishop because ...Bxb3 would be answered Rb8.  This actually wouldn't be that bad but I was getting short on time myself so just did some hasty calculations and went with it!
moves.33... Rb2: Unsure of how to proceed I just put my rook on the seventh rank.  Normally a good thing.  I think I would have rather put it directly on b7.
moves.34. Kg3 Rb7 35. Nxd5: Nxd5!  My opponent wishes to create 2 powerful linked, passed pawns at the expense of his knight.
moves.35... exd5 36. Rxd5 Rb3+: I don't want this king anywhere near his pawns.
moves.37. f3 Bc6 38. Rc5 Bd7: Setting up a "remote" blockade of sorts on e6 and e5.
moves.40. d5 Rb4+: Driving the king back and securing the e5 pawn.
